messages.subject: Re: Anyone interested in pen-pal for their kids/ possible frienship?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Vanessa, You should be able to connect with lots of unschoolers via postcards and the like via this group:
messages.messageBody:
Hi Vanessa,

You should be able to connect with lots of unschoolers via postcards
and the like via this group:

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingaroundtheworld/

a quote from the home page of the site:

> Would members of your unschooling family get a kick out of sending
> and receiving postcards from other unschooling families around the
> world?! That is the purpose of this group -- to unite unschooling
> families from across the globe through tangible tokens of Joy
> delivered right to the mailbox!

all the best
arun
_____________________________________________

http://www.theparentingpit.com





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Anyone interested in pen-pal for their kids/ possible frienship?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, We have been unschooling now for a year, and are just starting into our second year.  We haven t met any unschoolers in our area, but was wondering if
messages.messageBody:
Hi,

We have been unschooling now for a year, and are just starting into our
second year. We haven't met any unschoolers in our area, but was
wondering if anyone has a child that would like to have a pen pal, or a
new friend? We live in South Lyon, Michigan, and I have two children--
Tyler is 11 (will be 12 soon), and my daughter Alexandra is 10. They
are both great kids and enjoy a variety of things--Tyler loves video
games, and is into Naruto, and Pokemon. Alex is into the girly things-
like watching Hannah Montana, loves to read, loves animals, and
barbies, reading, and Disney Princesses.

Just thought I would throw this out there, in case anyone is
interested.


Thanks,

Vanessa
